description: Change of use from warehouse (B8 Use Class) at ground floor level and first floor residential flat (C3 Use Class) into house in multiple occupation (Sui Generis Use Class) to provide ten bedrooms for seventeen people (following partial demolition of  single storey rear extension to create rear courtyard) including associated cycle storage and refuse storage provision; first floor rear extension; two rear dormer extensions; raised roof ridge; installation of three roof lights to front roof slope; and external alterations including replacing all openings in front fa√ßade with the insertion of a door and four windows including two single storey bay window features
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: P-110-112WE-01 rev B, received 02 January 2018; P-110-112WE-02 rev C, received 02 January 2018; P-110-112WE-03 rev C, received 02 January 2018; P-110-112WE-04 rev A, received 02 January 2018; P-110-112WE-05 rev A, received 25 October 2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage are provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).
| A minimum of six cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in a secure undercover lockable compound, prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| The maximum number of persons occupying the house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to no more than ten bedrooms, to accommodate a maximum of seventeen residents.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy; and policy 7.4 of The London Plan (2016).
| The installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh shall be completed prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air. The ventilation system shall be completed prior to first occupation of the building and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to first occupation of each dwelling and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| The developer shall draw to the attention of the Local Planning Authority the presence of any unsuspected contamination encountered during the development. In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied.

In any event, documentary evidence that the excess spoil produced at the site due to the excavation shall be submitted to the council proving disposal of material to a suitably permitted / exempted waste facility took place.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment, to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use, and to prevent incorrect waste disposal i.e. fly tipping, in accordance with policies 1.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 5.16 and 5.21 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to occupation of the approved residential dwellings, certification shall be provided to the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that the party wall between the site and 108 West End Road and 114 West End Road is designed and constructed meeting the requirements for airborne sound insulation in accordance with Approved Document E [Resistance to the passage of sound].

Reason:  In the interests of amenity for the neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
